revision.comment: New page: Tools using or planning to use LibSBGN: = Editors = * [http://www.pathvisio.org PathVisio] has a plugin for creating, editing and exporting SBGN diagrams. Supports import of SBGN-ML Mile...
revision.text:
Tools using or planning to use LibSBGN:
= Editors =
* [http://www.pathvisio.org PathVisio] has a plugin for creating, editing and exporting SBGN diagrams. Supports import of SBGN-ML Milestone 1 and 2. Supports export of SBGN-ML Milestone 2 only. Supports all three sublanguages of SBGN. For instructions on how to install and use, see [http://pathvisio.org/wiki/PluginDocumentation#SBGN here]) * [http://www.sbgn-ed.org SBGN-ED], based on [http://www.vanted.org VANTED], allows editing, translating and validating of SBGN Maps. It currently supports Milestone 2 of SBGN-ML in the current release. * [http://www.celldesigner.org/ CellDesigner] will support SBGN-ML in the upcoming release.
= Other =
* [http://arcadiapathways.sourceforge.net/ Arcadia] will support SBGN-ML in the upcoming release. * [http://www.biopax.org/paxtools.php Paxtools] supports conversion from BioPAX to SBGN-ML. * [http://www.ra.cs.uni-tuebingen.de/software/KEGGtranslator/index.htm KEGG Translator] will support conversion from KEGG to SBGN-ML in the upcoming release. * [http://sbmllayout.sf.net/ SBML Layout and Rendering Extension] supports conversion from SBGN-ML. * [http://www.ebi.ac.uk/compneur-srv/converters/converters Systems Biology Format Converter] will support converting to and from various systems biology formats. * [http://www.bilkent.edu.tr/~bcbi/pvs.html VISIBIOweb], a free, open-source, web-based pathway visualization and layout services software for BioPAX (level 2) pathway models, can export to SBGN-ML. * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/cysbgn/ CySBGN], a plug-in for [http://www.cytoscape.org/ Cytoscape] is currently under development. * [http://www.reactome.org Reactome] is actively using LibSBGN.
